Basic read/write/erase functionality for Atmel AT26 series flash memory over SPI interface.

Define Documentation

#define LOG_START_ADDRESS   0x7000

FAT file system info
START ADDRESS is the memory address of logfile beginning
END ADDRESS is the memory address of logfile end

These addresses are used by flashLogData() as lower and upper bounds.
Not used by USB interface, instead used for writing data to flash by microcontroller which is later retrieved over USB. To simplify microcontroller access to filesystem, a single file exists which uses all free sectors. The start address of this file is LOG_START_ADDRESS and the last valid address of this file is LOG_END_ADDRESS, which should also correspond to the end of the flash memory.
Filessytem is initially imaged onto device by USB master.

#define NUMBER_OF_SECTORS   256

Flash Memory Logical Configuration
BYTES PER SECTOR should equal the size of smallest memory block which can be erased at a time, and be an even multiple of the flash programming Page Size.
NUMBER_OF_SECTORS = flash capacity / BYTES_PER_SECTOR.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum flashCommandStatus

Constants returned by flash read/write/erase functions.

Enumerator:
FLASH_CMD_OK 

command completed OK

FLASH_BUS_ERROR 

error reading/writing data bus

FLASH_HW_ERROR 

possible flash hardware error

Function Documentation

uint8_t flashLogData ( uint8_t *  data,
uint8_t  length 
)

Write data to flash memory.
Flash page size (256 bytes) must be evenly divisible by length Function not used by USB library, but used to write data to flash by microcontroller.

Parameters:
dataPointer to buffer from which to write to flash.
lengthNumber of bytes to write to flash.
Returns:
Returns appropriate flashCommandStatus enum value.
uint8_t flashSectorErase ( uint32_t  address,
uint16_t  count 
)

Erase consecutive sectors.
NOTE: Update call to flahshBlockErase_ depending on block size used.
NOTE: Update delay function to produce real delays of 10ms.

Parameters:
addressAddress from which to start erase.
countNumber of sectors to erase.
Returns:
Returns appropriate flashCommandStatus enum value.
uint8_t flashSectorRead ( uint32_t  address,
uint16_t  count,
uint8_t(*)(uint8_t *, uint8_t)  write 
)

Read consecutive sectors starting at address.
Function assumes sectors have been previously erased.

Parameters:
addressAddress from which to start reading.
countNumber of sectors to read.
writePointer to function to write data bus, which takes pointer to buffer, length, and returns 0 on success.
Returns:
Returns appropriate flashCommandStatus enum value.

uint16_t  count,

Parameters:
addressAddress from which to start writing.
countNumber of sectors to write.
readPointer to function to read data bus, which takes pointer to buffer and returns 0 on success.
Returns:

void initFlash ( void   )

Configure flash memory interface and unprotect flash memory. Set flash memory logging address to start of logfile.
